sen.j: 葬式仏教（そうしき ぶっきょう）とは、葬式や法事においては仏教の方式で執り行うが、実生活においては仏教の活動・教義とほとんど関わらない信仰のありかたを指す言葉である。
sen.e: The term "Soshikibukkyo" refers to the way of belief in which people perform funerals and memorial services in Buddhism style but have little concern about activities and dharma of Buddhism in daily lives.

Soshiki-Bukkyo' (literally, 'funeral Buddhism') refers to a way of belief in which people conduct Buddhist funerals and Buddhist memorial services while being rarely involved in Buddhist activities and in Buddhist doctrines in their daily lives.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Soshiki-Bukkyo' (literally, 'funeral Buddhism') refers to a way of belief in which people conduct Buddhist funerals and Buddhist memorial services while being rarely involved in Buddhist activities and in Buddhist doctrines in their daily lives.

sen.j: 脱教条化された仏教であり、純粋に死者を弔うことだけを目的とする原始宗教に近い。
sen.e: It is the Buddhism which have lost dogma and similar to a primitive religion which only aims to mourn for dead people purely.
It is the Buddhism which has lost dogma, and it is similar to a primitive religion purely for people to hold funerals.
sen.cmt: 文法。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: It is the Buddhism which has lost dogma, and it is similar to a primitive religion purely for people to hold funerals.

sen.j: 元来の仏教は、葬送儀礼を重視する宗教ではなかった。
sen.e: The original Buddhism was not a religion which emphasized funeral rites.
Buddhism was originally not a religion which emphasized funeral rites.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Buddhism was originally not a religion which emphasized funeral rites.

sen.j: 釈迦は弟子に死後の遺骸の処置を問われた際に、僧侶は遺骸の供養など考えず涅槃に専念すべきだ、供養は在家の信者がしてくれる、と答えたとされる。
sen.e: It is said that when Shakyamuni was asked about the treatment of the body by a disciple, he answered that priests should devote himself to nirvana without thinking about a memorial service for the dead and that it would be done by lay believers.

It has been told that when Buddha's disciples asked how to handle remains, Buddha answered that priests should concentrate intently on finding nirvana without worrying about memorial services after their death as the laity would hold memorial services for them.
sen.cmt: 用語。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: It has been told that when Buddha's disciples asked how to handle remains, Buddha answered that priests should concentrate intently on finding nirvana without worrying about memorial services after their death as the laity would hold memorial services for them.

sen.j: 現在も僧侶が、遺体・遺骨・墓石などにタッチしないのはこのためである。
sen.e: This is why priests do not relate with the body, cremains and gravestone still now.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is why even present Buddhist priests are not involved in handling remains nor gravestones.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: This is why even present Buddhist priests are not involved in handling remains nor gravestones.

sen.j: 江戸時代から明治期には、隠亡と呼ばれる人たちがこうした雑務を行っていた。
sen.e: From the Edo period to the Meiji period, the people called Onbo were in charge of such routine tasks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: From the Edo period to the Meiji period, the people called Onbo were in charge of such routine tasks.
From the Edo period to the Meiji period, the people called Onbo were in charge of such routine tasks.

sen.j: 現在も三十五日、四十九日などの納骨が行われるときには、斎場の職員が寺まで出張して、墓石の開閉や、遺族が遺骨を納めるときの介助などをしてくれることが多い。
sen.e: Even today, when the cremains are laid into gravestone on the 35th or 49th day after death, funeral hall's staff often go to a temple and help bereaved family to open and close a gravestone or lay cremains.

Even today, at the rite placing the ashes of the dead in the grave on the 35th day or 49th day after the death, staff of a funeral hall usually assist the bereaved in opening and closing of the gravestone, handling the urn and other things.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Even today, at the rite placing the ashes of the dead in the grave on the 35th day or 49th day after the death, staff of a funeral hall usually assist the bereaved in opening and closing of the gravestone, handling the urn and other things.

sen.j: しかし、インドから中国へと伝播し民衆へと教化が行われるうちに、漢民族の道教や儒教に由来する先祖供養の民間信仰と習合し、仏教は葬送儀礼をも司るようになった。
sen.e: However, while Buddhism had been transmitted from India to China and enlightened common people, it got together with folk belief for memorial service for the ancestor which was originated from Taoism and Confucianism of the Han race and became to manage funeral rites as well.

However, in the process that Buddhism spread from India to China and became familiarized to the common people, it had assimilated the Han race's folk religion for memorial services for ancestors which originated from Taoism and Confucianism, and at last Buddhist priests became to manage funeral rites as well.
sen.cmt: 文法。用語。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: However, in the process that Buddhism spread from India to China and became familiarized to the common people, it had assimilated the Han race's folk religion for memorial services for ancestors which originated from Taoism and Confucianism, and at last Buddhist priests became to manage funeral rites as well.

sen.j: 例えば位牌は、儒教の葬礼に用いられる神主（しんしゅ）が変化されたものだと考えられている。
sen.e: For example, ihai (ancestral tablets) is thought to be a modification of Shinshu which is used for a funeral of Confucianism.
For example, it is said that ihai ('lingpai' or 'paiwei' in Chinese, Buddhist memorial tablet) is a modification of shinshu ('shenzhu' or 'shenwei' in Chinese) at a Confucian funeral.
sen.cmt: 用語。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: For example, it is said that ihai ('lingpai' or 'paiwei' in Chinese, Buddhist memorial tablet) is a modification of shinshu ('shenzhu' or 'shenwei' in Chinese) at a Confucian funeral.

sen.j: 仏教が日本に仏教伝来したのは6世紀半ばの飛鳥時代のことである。
sen.e: Buddhism was introduced to Japan in the middle of the sixth century during Asuka period.
Buddhism was introduced to Japan in the middle of the sixth century during the Asuka period.
Buddhism was introduced to Japan in the middle of the sixth century during the Asuka period.

sen.j: 仏教は豪族など上層階級の心を捉え、篤く信仰されるようになった。
sen.e: Buddhism caught the heart of upper class such as powerful family and became to be believed deeply.
Buddhism won the hearts and minds of the upper class including gozoku (powerful families in the Asuka period) and became a religion embraced enthusiastically by people in Japan.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Buddhism won the hearts and minds of the upper class including gozoku (powerful families in the Asuka period) and became a religion embraced enthusiastically by people in Japan.

sen.j: 平安時代の貴族の葬儀は、仏教寺院で行い僧侶が念仏し墓に卒塔婆を立てるなど、大きく仏教的な影響を受けたものになっていた。
sen.e: The funeral of noble in the Heian period was greatly influenced by Buddhism as it was held at a Buddhist temple, priests invoked Buddhist invocation, and a stupa was built around gravestone.

In the Heian period, court nobles f'unerals were greatly influenced by Buddhism as they were held at Buddhist temples, priests chanted Buddhist invocations, and stupas were set up at the sides of gravestones.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the Heian period, court nobles f'unerals were greatly influenced by Buddhism as they were held at Buddhist temples, priests chanted Buddhist invocations, and stupas were set up at the sides of gravestones.

sen.j: 鎌倉時代には庶民層にも仏教が広まり、庶民のあいだにも仏式の葬儀が行われる例が見られるようになる。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, Buddhism was spread among common people, and funerals in Buddhism style were often held among them.
In the Kamakura period, Buddhism was spread among the common people, and some funerals of the common people were held in Buddhist style.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In the Kamakura period, Buddhism was spread among the common people, and some funerals of the common people were held in Buddhist style.

sen.j: 日本仏教が葬式仏教へと向かう大きな転機は、江戸時代前期に幕府が定めた檀家制度である。
sen.e: The big turning point for Buddhism in Japan to change to Soshikibukkyo was the danka seido system which was established by bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in the early part of the Edo period.
The major turning point for Buddhism of Japan to change into Soshiki-Bukkyo was the Danka system established by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in the early Edo period.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: The major turning point for Buddhism of Japan to change into Soshiki-Bukkyo was the Danka system established by the bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun) in the early Edo period.

sen.j: 檀家制度は、民衆はいずれかの寺院を菩提寺としてその檀家となる事を義務づけるものである。
sen.e: The danka seido system obliged common people to become danka (supporter of a Buddhist temple) of any family temple.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the Danka system, all the common people had to belong to bodaiji (family temple) and become the temple's danka (supporter of a Buddhist temple).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: According to the Danka system, all the common people had to belong to bodaiji (family temple) and become the temple's danka (supporter of a Buddhist temple).

sen.j: キリスト教や不受不施派を禁制として、信徒に対し強制改宗した。
sen.e: It banned Christianity and Fujufuse (Not Receive and Not Give) School and forced their believers to change their faith.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: And Christianity and Fujufuse School (based on the principles of not receiving and not giving) were banned and the believers were forced to convert to Buddhism.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: And Christianity and Fujufuse School (based on the principles of not receiving and not giving) were banned and the believers were forced to convert to Buddhism.

sen.j: それに抗して一部の者は「隠れ」となることを強いられる。
sen.e: Some people opposed this and were forced to be 'cryptos.'
Some people resisted it and were forced to become 'kakure' (hidden believers).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Some people resisted it and were forced to become 'kakure' (hidden believers).

sen.j: それまでの民衆の葬式は一般に村社会が執り行うものであったが、檀家制度以降、僧侶による葬式が一般化した。
sen.e: Funerals of common people so far were generally held by village society, but after the introduction of danka seido system, those by priests became popular.
Before the introduction of the Danka system, the funerals of the common people were generally held by each village, however, after the introduction those by Buddhist priests became common.
sen.cmt: 用語。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Before the introduction of the Danka system, the funerals of the common people were generally held by each village, however, after the introduction those by Buddhist priests became common.

sen.j: また、檀家制度は、寺院に一定の信徒と収入を保証する一方で、他宗派の信徒への布教や新しい寺院の建立を禁止した。
sen.e: In addition, while the danka seido system guaranteed temples of a certain amount of believers and income, it forbade the propagation for other sects' believers and the construction of a new temple.
In addition, while the Danka system guaranteed temples of a certain amount of believers and income, it forbade the propagation to other sects' believers and the construction of a new temple.
In addition, while the Danka system guaranteed temples of a certain amount of believers and income, it forbade the propagation to other sects' believers and the construction of a new temple.

sen.j: このことにより、各寺院は布教の機会と必要を同時に無くし、自らの檀家の葬儀や法事を営み定期的に収入を得るばかりの、変化のない生活に安住するようになっていった。
sen.e: As a result, each temple lost the opportunities and necessity of propagation at the same time and became to keep themselves in uneventful life only with holding funerals and memorial services of their danka and gaining income regularly.

As a result, each temple lost the opportunities and necessity of propagation at the same time and gradually became content with the uneventful life just holding funerals and memorial services for the danka and gaining the regular income.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: As a result, each temple lost the opportunities and necessity of propagation at the same time and gradually became content with the uneventful life just holding funerals and memorial services for the danka and gaining the regular income.

sen.j: また、日本の多くの寺院が、事実上世襲となっていることも葬式仏教化へと拍車をかけている。
sen.e: In addition, it also promotes to become Soshikibukkyo that many temples in Japan adopt hereditary system in fact.
The hereditary system which has been adopted in most temples of Japan is the major factor in causing the generalization of Soshiki-Bukkyo.
sen.cmt: 用語の統一。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: The hereditary system which has been adopted in most temples of Japan is the major factor in causing the generalization of Soshiki-Bukkyo.

sen.j: 近年、このような葬儀や法事に依存した日本仏教の状況を批判する意味で、葬式仏教という言葉が使われるようになった。
sen.e: Reentry, the term Soshikibukkyo has become to be used in the meaning of criticism against such situation of Buddhism in Japan which depends on funerals and memorial services.
People began to use the term 'Soshiki-Bukkyo' recently for criticizing the situation of Japanese Buddhism which depends on funerals and memorial services.
sen.cmt: スペル。わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: People began to use the term 'Soshiki-Bukkyo' recently for criticizing the situation of Japanese Buddhism which depends on funerals and memorial services.

sen.j: 仏教界内部からもこの状況を反省し改めるべきだとする活動が様々に行われている。
sen.e: In the society of Buddhism, there are various activities which aim to reflect on and change such situation.
From the inside of Japanese Buddhist circles, priests began various activities to think about their past and change the situation.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: From the inside of Japanese Buddhist circles, priests began various activities to think about their past and change the situation.

sen.j: 伝統的な宗派に属する寺院でも、不登校の問題や自殺防止などに取り組んだり、宗教家の立場で人々の相談に乗ったるする寺院など、人々の心の問題に取り組もうとする動きが伝統的な仏教界にも見られている。
sen.e: Some temples of traditional sects have tried to face the problems of people's mind such as tackling with truancy and suicide prevention and consulting people's worry as a person of religion.

Today the Buddhist circles, which had been keeping a lot of traditions, is trying to assist people in solving problems of minds; for example, some temple of traditional sects are involved in the prevention of school truancy and suicide, and some priests guide people as persons of religion.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Today the Buddhist circles, which had been keeping a lot of traditions, is trying to assist people in solving problems of minds; for example, some temple of traditional sects are involved in the prevention of school truancy and suicide, and some priests guide people as persons of religion.

sen.j: また、葬式仏教的な現状に飽き足らない人々の中には、既成の宗派の枠やしきたりを超えた活動や、アジア諸国など海外の仏教に目を向ける人々もいる。
sen.e: Among the people who can not be satisfied with the present situation of Shoshikibukkyo, some have begun activities which surpass the framework of conventional sects and traditions or studied overseas Buddhism of Asian countries and so on.

Some people, who are not satisfied with the present situation of Soshiki-Bukkyo, began Buddhist activities breaking down the borders between the conventional sects and the traditions, some of them are even attracted to overseas Buddhism including Buddhism of other Asian countries.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: Some people, who are not satisfied with the present situation of Soshiki-Bukkyo, began Buddhist activities breaking down the borders between the conventional sects and the traditions, some of them are even attracted to overseas Buddhism including Buddhism of other Asian countries.

sen.j: また、近年では、過疎化などの進展で地域だけで葬儀が遂行できないこと、逆に都市化やライフスタイルの変化、葬儀のあり方の多様化などにより、「葬式仏教すら成り立たない」寺院も存在する。
sen.e: In addition, recently some temples 'even can not be called Soshikibukkyo' since a funeral can not be held only by local people because of the depopulation or, on the contrary, the urbanization, the change of life style, and the diversification of funeral.

In addition, recently there are some temples 'cannot keep even Soshiki-Bukkyo' due to various problems; some under-populated areas are not able to hold funerals on their own; on the contrary, some areas suffers from the urbanization; there are also the problems that temples cannot react to the changes of styles of living nor to the diversification of funeral.
sen.cmt: わかりやすくしました。
sen.e: In addition, recently there are some temples 'cannot keep even Soshiki-Bukkyo' due to various problems; some under-populated areas are not able to hold funerals on their own; on the contrary, some areas suffers from the urbanization; there are also the problems that temples cannot react to the changes of styles of living nor to the diversification of funeral.
